alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:28AM CDT until May 12 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Stratton affecting Hitchcock County. For the Republican River...including Stratton...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Republican River At Stratton. * WHEN...From this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet this morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM CDT.
